results.title: The Shout it out alphabet film
results.brief_description: In this film, simple and vivid collage animation brings words to life in a series of playful appenings involving all letters of the alphabet. It is really a film game in which an audience of children tries to see how many “A” words, “B” words, and so on to “Z”, they can discover on the screen. The process of learning the alphabet and understanding the connection between letters, sounds and words becomes a pleasure.

results.title: The 'Shop steward'
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A dramatized presentation of the role of the shop steward in the effective day-to-day funtioning of free trade unionism. The film beings with the election of machinists Johnny Walachuk as shop steward for the men in his section of a large industrial plant. Continuing, it shows the part the shop steward plays in carrying out the grievance procedures set up by company and union. How Johnny fulfills responsibility to protect from infractions of the agreement the men who elected him, is told in his own words and typifies the function of the union shop stewards generally in Canada.

results.title: Sheridan's world of society: 18th century London (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: James Wilkins, ICEM and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description: Traces the life of Richard Brinsley Sheridan and evokes the leisurely world of 18th century English society, which enjoyed his plays but never accepted him into its midst. Contemporary paintings and cartoons reveal the favourite pastimes of this society, including a performance of “The school for scandal”.

results.title: Sheep in the desert
results.brief_description: Shows how sheep can be raised successfully in low rainfall areas of Australia. It concentrates on one large station, Wilgena, nearly two million acres in extent and carrying 45,000 sheep. This station is self supporting, generating its own power and light, and is fitted with the most modern appliances. It produces sheep of fine quality and is entirely mechanised, the sheep being rounded up by men on motor bikes. In an area with an average rainfall of only 5 and a half inches, much needed water is supplied by sub-artesian bores. Vermin-proof fences check pasture destruction by rabbits and stock losses by dingoes.

results.title: Shed Tears for the River
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Nicholas Alexander and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Deals with the many environmental crises of the River Murray, past and present. The problems are emphasised by travelling along the river and talking to the people who are dependant upon it for water, irrigation, food and recreation. Script, David Corke; photography, Nicholas Alexander.
